description:
The shell is a program that takes commands from the keyboard and gives them to the operating system to perform. We recommend the finest free and open source shells.

The post 19 Best Free and Open-Source Shells appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 19 Best Free and Open-Source Shells

description:
CachyOS’s 9th 2024 release includes the NVIDIA open module, Cosmic Desktop, and a globally faster CDN experience.

The post CachyOS August Update Brings Open NVIDIA Modules and Cosmic DE appeared first on Linux Today.
title: CachyOS August Update Brings Open NVIDIA Modules and Cosmic DE

description:
A list of recommendations and a comparison of the best gamepads (controllers) for Linux. All are compatible and PnP.

The post Best Gamepads for Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Best Gamepads for Linux

description:
Pulsar 1.120, an open-source and cross-platform code editor, now has better icons, improved JavaScript indentation, and updated ‘ppm’ functionalities.

The post Pulsar 1.120 Rolls Out With Advanced Code Handling Features appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Pulsar 1.120 Rolls Out With Advanced Code Handling Features

description:
The Open Model Initiative aims to promote the development and adoption of openly licensed AI models that stay open source

The post Linux Foundation Backs Open Source LLM Initiative appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Linux Foundation Backs Open Source LLM Initiative

description:
Ikey Doherty was kind enough to share with us details about the upcoming Serpent OS Alpha release, which promises to enable support for the Framework 13 laptop, support for installing Flatpak apps from Flathub by default, improved support for AMD Ryzen systems, and considerably more hardware support.

The post Serpent OS Gears Up for Alpha Release, Enables Framework 13 and Flathub Support appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Serpent OS Gears Up for Alpha Release, Enables Framework 13 and Flathub Support
